entry.title: Nigerian Crypto Firm Bitmama to Pay $1 Million for Startup That Raised $3 Million in February
entry.summary:
The Nigerian crypto platform Bitmama is reportedly set to acquire the African remittances startup Payday for $1 million. Reports of Paydayâ€™s acquisition come almost a year after the startup raised $3 million in a funding round.
Bitmamaâ€™s Pivot From Crypto
The Nigerian crypto platform Bitmama is set to acquire the cross-border payment startup Payday for a reported sum of $1 million. The acquisition deal, which puts Paydayâ€™s value at $30 million, allows Bitmama to broaden its product offering to include cross-border remittances without having to start this service from scratch.
According to a Dec. 5 Techcabal report, Bitmamaâ€™s yet-to-be-consumated acquisition deal comes nearly a year after the previously high-flying Payday successfully raised $3 million in a funding round. Commenting on the deal, Favour Ori, founder and CEO of Payday, said:
â€œThe deal is a work in progress. If the deal goes through, the result will be a strong team with much more efficiency.â€
When the deal is finalized, Bitmama is expected to take over Paydayâ€™s customer deposits and the remittance firmâ€™s liabilities.
Ruth Iselema, who founded Bitmama in 2019, explained how her platformâ€™s pivot away from its crypto-only approach convinced Ori to approach. She also suggested that Bitmamaâ€™s desire to become a leading remittance service provider made the deal to buy Payday even more lucrative.
Meanwhile, Paydayâ€™s downfall may be linked to the founderâ€™s extravagance and brash management style as well as the companyâ€™s failure to effectively deal with customer complaints, according to reports.
What are your thoughts on this story? Let us know what you think in the comments section below.

93% Of All Bitcoin Has Now Been Mined, How Much BTC Is Left?
entry.summary:
The total Bitcoin supply which is pegged at 21 million has been continuously mined since the coin was first introduced back in 2009. Now, 14 years later, the mined percentage of this total supply sits at 93%, so how much BTC is left to mine?
93% Of Bitcoin Supply Already Mined
The total mined Bitcoin crossed 19 million back in 2022 and the figure has continually risen since then. Then in December 2023, the total percentage of the total BTC supply that has been mined crossed the 93% threshold, and Binance, the largest crypto exchange in the world, took to Twitter to share this milestone.
According to data from Blockchain.com, a total of 19,560,877.158 BTC has been mined as of December 5. This means that between April 2022 and December 2023, less than 600 BTC were brought into circulâ€¦

entry.title: The Economics of On-Chain Governance: Incentives, Rewards, and Financial Sustainability
entry.summary: On-chain governance changes how decisions are made in decentralized systems. Unlike traditional ways involving discussions off the blockchain, on-chain governance uses the blockchain for decision-making. This process is done through smart contracts, which are self-executing agreements. In on-chain governance, decisions and voting are programmed into smart contracts, making the entire process transparent and recorded on the unchangeable blockchain. This method aligns with decentralization, where power isn't held by a few individuals but distributed among the participants. This decentralization reduces the risks of central control and strengthens the security of blockchain networks. A crucial aspect of on-chain governance is the role of economic incentives. Token holders actively particiâ€¦

entry.title: Balancing Risk and Opportunity: Can Institutions Afford to Ignore Crypto Any Longer?
entry.summary: When institutions larger than the cryptocurrency ecosystem begin to wake up to the potential of crypto, itâ€™s certainly food for thought. Can the ever-evolving world of crypto remain outside of mainstream adoption for much longer? Larry Fink, the CEO of BlackRock, the largest asset management firm in the world with around $9.4 trillion in AUM, doesnâ€™t appear to pull any punches when it comes to speaking his mind. In 2017, Fink dismissed crypto as an â€œindex of money laundering.â€ But just three years later the BlackRock CEO admitted that assets like Bitcoin had caught his attention. â€œI do believe the role of crypto is itâ€™s digitizing gold in many ways,â€ Fink said in a recent interview with Fox Business, while also referring to BTC as an â€œinternational asset.â€ Today, BlackRock is geariâ€¦

entry.title: Institutional Tradersâ€™ BTC Holding Percentage Increased â€˜Almost Twofoldâ€™ Between January and September â€” Study
entry.summary:
The bitcoin held by institutional traders (INS) in their respective crypto portfolios saw an â€œalmost twofoldâ€ increase in the initial three quarters of 2023. Institutional tradersâ€™ BTC allocation shifted from under 40% in January to nearly 50% by the end of September.
The Spot Bitcoin ETF Factor
According to a study conducted by the crypto platform Bybit, the bitcoin held by INS saw an â€œalmost twofold increase in their Bitcoin holding percentageâ€ during the initial three quarters of 2023. The study report suggests that the accumulation trends by these traders depict a pattern which is distinct from that of VIP and retail traders.
For context, the BTC holding percentages for the VIP and retail traders at the start of 2023 and the end of Q3 are almost identical. Even after the June BTCâ€¦

Elizabeth Warren, a United States Senator has voiced her concerns about the role of cryptocurrency at large and the threat it poses in the global landscape while stressing the need for a better regulation.
US Senator Calls Cryptocurrency A Rising Threat
A pseudomynous user on X (formerly Twitter) recently took to the social media platform to share the US senatorâ€™s opposition to cryptocurrency. The X post was accompanied by a short video of Warrenâ€™s interview on CNBCâ€™s Squawkbox Newsmaker.
In the interview, Warren stated that â€œthere is a new threat out there, and it is crypto.â€ The senatorâ€™s assertion is apparently due to the risk of criminal activities that cryptocurrency poses.
Senator Warrenâ€™s viewpoint is consistent with the more general concern regarding the unregulated naturâ€¦

Noones Targeting the Global South
Ray Youssef, one of the founders of Paxful, has been appointed as the chief executive officer at the peer-to-peer bitcoin marketplace Noones. Youssef, who left Paxful in April, is expected to spearhead the young firmâ€™s ambitious goal of garnering a billion bitcoin users in the next seven years.

entry.title: UAE Bitcoin Miner Signs Order Worth Over $380 Million With Microbt
entry.summary:
United Arab Emirates-based bitcoin miner Phoenix Group PLC has signed an order worth more than $380 million with Whatsminer mining rig maker Microbt. Bijan Alizadehfard described the collaboration with Microbt as a reflection of his companyâ€™s â€œstrategic foresight.â€
Microbt to Integrate Hydro-Cooling Miners
Phoenix Group PLC, a bitcoin mining company based in the United Arab Emirates (UAE), has signed an order worth more than $380 million with Microbt, a mining rig manufacturer. As part of the agreement, Phoenix Group PLC will receive mining equipment valued at $136 million, with an additional option worth $246 million.
The UAE-based bitcoin miner is also collaborating with Microbt to integrate hydro-cooling miners, which is a significant milestone towards Phoenix Groupâ€™s goal of creating High-Performance Computing (HPC) data centers. Bijan Alizadehfard, the co-founder and CEO of Phoenix Group PLC, described the collaboration with Microbt as a reflection of his companyâ€™s strategic foresight.
â€œThis collaboration with Whatsminer [Microbt] is a milestone for Phoenix Group, reflecting our strategic foresight and commitment to pioneering in the tech industry. Our successful listing on the ADX has further empowered us to pursue such significant partnerships, enhancing our capabilities in the blockchain and cryptocurrency sector,â€ Alizadehfard said.
Phoenix Group has announced a multi-million dollar deal with Microbt, coming just days after its highly successful initial public offering (IPO) which raised over $370 million.
The oversubscribed IPO and the deal with Microbt both signal a new era of growth and innovation for the UAE company. Phoenix Group PLC aims to leverage these advancements to reinforce its position as a leader in the global technology industry.
What are your thoughts on this story? Let us know what you think in the comments section below.

entry.title: VanEckâ€™s 2024 Bitcoin And Crypto Blueprint: 15 Predictions You Canâ€™t Miss

#1 US Recession And Bitcoin ETFs: Sigel and Bush start with a macroeconomic perspective, predicting a US recession in early 2024. This economic downturn coincides with the anticipated launch of the first spot Bitcoin ETFs in the United States.

entry.title: Binance Evaluated â€œGlobal Licensing Needsâ€ under CZ: Withdrew Abu Dhabi Bid
entry.summary:
Binance, the largest crypto exchange in terms of trading volume, has withdrawn its bid for a collective investment fund. This application was previously submitted to the financial market regulator in Abu Dhabi. The decision to retract its bid stems from Binance's ongoing reassessment of its â€œglobal licensing needs", according to the company. Is Binance Rethinking Its MENA Strategy?
As seen on the Abu Dhabi Global Market (ADGM) register, Binanceâ€™s local subsidiary, BV Investment Management Limited, applied for the license on 15 November 2022 and withdrew the application on 7 November 2023. The license would have enabled the exchange to offer services to professional clients.
Notably, during those decisions, Changpeng Zhao was still in charge of Binance as the CEO. Zhao stepped down laâ€¦

entry.title: Binance Founder CZ Remanded to Remain in Continental US, Travel to UAE Prohibited
entry.summary:
Changpeng Zhao, better known as CZ, the founder of Binance, has recently grappled with significant legal hurdles in the U.S. His guilty plea in a notable case led a Seattle federal judge to impose movement restrictions on him.
Former Binance Boss CZ Restricted to U.S. Soil
As the pivotal figure of Binance, CZ admitted guilt for not establishing anti-money laundering measures and breaching U.S. sanctions. His plea, which included resigning as the CEO, brought considerable repercussions for both him and the crypto exchange firm.
U.S. District Judge Richard Jones, on Thursday, reversed a previous ruling that would have permitted Zhao to travel back to the United Arab Emirates (UAE). Pointing to Zhaoâ€™s substantial assets and weak connections to the U.S., Judge Jones highlighted the flight risk he poses. This decision came after Jones consented to the plea agreement between the U.S. authorities and CZ, amid Binanceâ€™s settlement process.
Judge Jones expressed that the court wasnâ€™t persuaded by assurances that CZ wouldnâ€™t flee if allowed to go to the UAE, a country with which the U.S. lacks an extradition agreement. Consequently, he ordered CZ to remain within the mainland U.S. until his sentencing in February 2024. CZ could face up to 18 months in prison for these offenses.
Many speculate that CZ might avoid jail time, akin to Arthur Hayes, the ex-CEO of Bitmex. Hayes received a sentence of six months of house arrest and two years probation for violating the Bank Secrecy Act (BSA) by not instituting an anti-money laundering (AML) system at Bitmex. Although Hayes faced a potential prison sentence, his guilty plea and the settlement of fines helped him evade incarceration.
What do you think about the latest court ruling against the former Binance boss CZ? Share your thoughts and opinions about this subject in the comments section below.

entry.title: Ex-CEO of Binance 'Is a Flight Risk': Must Stay in the US until Sentencing
entry.summary:
Changpeng Zhao, the Founder and former CEO of Binance, must stay in the United States until his sentencing is scheduled in February, a US federal judge ruled on Thursday. This decision overruled Zhao's previous bail agreement that would have allowed him to visit his UAE residency but requires him to return to the US two weeks before his sentencing.
The ruling came only a day after the court accepted Zhao's guilty plea for violating one count of Bank Secrecy Act violation.
Bail Agreement Does not Guarantee Free Movement
Zhao entered the guilty plea last month and consecutively signed a $175 million bond agreement. He already put up about $15 million in an escrow account and found guarantors for the additional funds.
Although the initial bail agreement permitted him to leave the â€¦

entry.title: Pat Felder - The worst is over [Macro Deep Dive Episode]
entry.summary:
Welcome to the first Markets Edition of This Time Will Be Different! In this episode we dive into the current macroeconomic conditions around crypto and look at the data behind the price action.
Reza sits down with Pat Felder, founder of Prismatic Capital to discuss the current macro environment, and to answer the question on everyone's mind-- is the bear market really over?

entry.title: The Sandbox Co-Founder Sebastien Borget: 'We're Already Integrating AI'
entry.summary: Decrypt sat down with The Sandbox co-founder Sebastien Borget at Web Summit to talk about AI, the open metaverse and the creative challenges of interoperability.

entry.title: Dacoco CEO Saro McKenna: How Alien Worlds is Creating an AI-Powered 'Lore DAO' with Kevin J Anderson
entry.summary: Decrypt joined Dacoco CEO Sarojini McKenna at Web Summit 2023 to talk about Alien Worlds' new Lore DAO and its AI-powered collaboration with sci-fi author Kevin J Anderson.

entry.title: Avalon's Jeffrey Butler on Designing a Metaverse MMO That Lets Players Co-Create
entry.summary: Avalon Chief Product Officer Jeffrey Butler speaks with Decrypt reporter Jason Nelson and details his studio's new MMO game with interoperable assetsâ€”and how it will enable players to create and monetize their own content.

entry.title: How Gen Z Is Different: OTK Chief Strategy Officer Talks Creator Economy Shift and Rise of Kick
entry.summary: One True King, an esports and gaming lifestyle brand and media company, was founded by creators like Asmongold and Mizkif. OTK's Chief Strategy Officer Zachary Diaz, who previously worked at TikTok and Twitch, shares with Decrypt's Kate Irwin about how the creator economy is changing.

entry.title: MoisÃ©s Zamora on Videomart and Bucking the Hollywood System
entry.summary: "Selena: The Series" creator and co-showrunner MoisÃ©s Zamora joins Decrypt's Sander Lutz at the Film3 Summit 2023 to discuss why the Hollywood system is broken and why he founded the Videomart NFT digital film marketplace to give creators more power.

entry.title: Why OTK Is Making Video Games
entry.summary: One True King (OTK) Chief Strategy Officer Zachary Diaz tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about OTK's long-term strategy and vision to become a content creator-powered media and video games company.
